Generate a LoginStudio object for the IQB Studio Lite

login_studio.Rd

Provides a routine to login to an instance of the IQB Studio Lite.

Usage

login_studio(
  base_url = "https://www.iqb-studio.de/",
  app_version = "12.3.1",
  keyring = FALSE,
  change_key = FALSE,
  dialog = TRUE,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

base_url

Character. Base URL of the hosted instance of the IQB Studio Lite. Default is the https://www.iqb-studio.de/.

app_version

Character. App version of the IQB Studio instance. Defaults to "12.3.1".

keyring

Logical. Should the keyring package be used to save the passkey? This saves your credentials to your local machine. Defaults to FALSE.

change_key

Logical. If your password on the domain has changed - should the keyring password be changed? Defaults to FALSE.

dialog

Logical. Should the password be entered using the RStudio dialog (TRUE) or using the console (FALSE). Defaults to TRUE.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, additional information is printed. Defaults to FALSE.

Value

An object of the LoginStudio class.

Details

Calling the login_studio() function generates the following curl request on the base_url (default is "https://www.iqb-studio.de/) with the name and the password provided by the user:

curl --location --request POST '{base_url}/api/login?username={name}&password={password}'
--header 'app-version: 12.3.1'
}'

Note that the name and the password are only available to the function call and cannot be accessed later as they are not part of the Login object generated.
